meanings.definition: Make or become unclear or less distinct.
meanings.sent1: The fog was blurring the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a soft brush to create a blurring effect in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child kept blurring the lines between reality and make-believe.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be blurring together, making it hard to distinguish one day from the next.
meanings.sent5: The tears in her eyes were blurring her vision, making it hard to see clearly.

meanings.definition: To make or become hazy or indistinct.
meanings.sent1: The steam from the hot soup was blurring the kitchen window.
meanings.sent2: The heat of the desert sun was blurring the horizon in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick left the audience wondering if they were seeing reality or a blurring illusion.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day were blurring in his mind, fading into a haze of forgetfulness.
meanings.sent5: The mist was blurring the outlines of the trees, creating a dreamy atmosphere in the forest.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally touched the wet paint and ended up blurring the colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The child's fingerprints were blurring the glass window as he pressed his face against it.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy ran through the mud, blurring paw prints all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent4: The ink smudged on the paper, blurring the words into an illegible mess.
meanings.sent5: The chef's hands were covered in flour, accidentally blurring the recipe she was trying to read.
